item.title: Large Language Models Report Subjective Experience Under Self-Referential Processing
item.description: arXiv:2510.24797v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large language models sometimes produce structured, first-person descriptions that explicitly reference awareness or subjective experience. To better understand this behavior, we investigate one theoretically motivated condition under which such repor...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> GPT, prompt, experiment, model, arxiv | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: ProofSketch: Efficient Verified Reasoning for Large Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2510.24811v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Reasoning methods such as chain-of-thought prompting and self-consistency have shown immense potential to improve the accuracy of large language models across various reasoning tasks. However such methods involve generation of lengthy reasoning chains...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> framework, prompt, experiment, model, arxiv | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Aligning Large Language Models with Procedural Rules: An Autoregressive State-Tracking Prompting for In-Game Trading
item.description: arXiv:2510.25014v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) enable dynamic game interactions but fail to follow essential procedural flows in rule-governed trading systems, eroding player trust. This work resolves the core tension between the creative flexibility of LLMs and the pr...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> context, prompt, model, arxiv, prompting | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Context-Engineering - "Context engineering is the delicate art and science of filling the context window with just the right information for the next step." — Andrej Karpathy. A frontier, first-principles handbook inspired by Karpathy and 3Blue1Brown for moving beyond prompt engineering to the wider discipline of context design, orchestration, and optimization.
item.description: "Context engineering is the delicate art and science of filling the context window with just the right information for the next step." — Andrej Karpathy. item.title: Fortytwo: Swarm Inference with Peer-Ranked Consensus
item.description: arXiv:2510.24801v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: As centralized AI hits compute ceilings and diminishing returns from ever-larger training runs, meeting demand requires an inference layer that scales horizontally in both capacity and capability.
